In a message dated 6/16/2003 1:26:47 PM Central Daylight Time, 
jggilbert@... writes:

> Sometimes you find plates that have had a fukurin removed, but you can 
> still see a ring left on the surface where it was applied.  One method of 
> attaching a fukurin involved cutting a small rectangular notch in the mimi (usually 
> at the "6 o'clock" position), and sometimes you'll see this on a piece that 
> has lost the rim cover.
> 
> Jim
> 

Jim, 
I have one tsuba with  the notch at 6 O'clock just as you described.
The mimi was finished quite smooth and nice though. So the missing fukurin 
most likely was placed there  for esthetic reason then.

Milt
